title: Drawing, "Vaulted Ceiling with Alternative Designs", ca. 1750
medium: Pen and ink over traces of graphite on greyish laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Row of big coffers of various design, supported by pointed arches separated by spandrels. Representations in lunettes, at bottom of arches, reference to Athena as protector of arts. Candelabrum motifs in spandrels.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Vaulted Ceiling with Alternative Designs", ca. 1750.
ca. 1750. Pen and ink over traces of graphite on greyish laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-4922.
